moduleMetadataJson.name: HTTP Client Automatic Exploiter 2 (Browser Autopwn)
moduleMetadataJson.description:
This module will automatically serve browser exploits. Here are the options you can
        configure:

        The INCLUDE_PATTERN option allows you to specify the kind of exploits to be loaded. For example,
        if you wish to load just Adobe Flash exploits, then you can set Include to 'adobe_flash'.

        The EXCLUDE_PATTERN option will ignore exploits. For example, if you don't want any Adobe Flash
        exploits, you can set this. Also note that the Exclude option will always be evaluated
        after the Include option.

        The MaxExploitCount option specifies the max number of exploits to load by Browser Autopwn.
        By default, 20 will be loaded. But note that the client will probably not be vulnerable
        to all 20 of them, so only some will actually be served to the client.

        The HTMLContent option allows you to provide a basic webpage. This is what the user behind
        the vulnerable browser will see. You can simply set a string, or you can do the file://
        syntax to load an HTML file. Note this option might break exploits so try to keep it
        as simple as possible.

        The MaxSessionCount option is used to limit how many sessions Browser Autopwn is allowed to
        get. The default -1 means unlimited. Combining this with other options such as RealList
        and Custom404, you can get information about which visitors (IPs) clicked on your malicious
        link, what exploits they might be vulnerable to, redirect them to your own internal
        training website without actually attacking them.

        For more information about Browser Autopwn, please see the referenced blog post.
author: sinn3r <sinn3r@metasploit.com>

options.name: WORKSPACE
options.description: Specify the workspace for this module

options.name: VERBOSE
options.description: Enable detailed status messages

options.name: SRVHOST
options.description: The local host or network interface to listen on. This must be an address on the local machine or 0.0.0.0 to listen on all addresses.

options.name: SRVPORT
options.description: The local port to listen on.

options.name: ListenerComm
options.description: The specific communication channel to use for this service

options.name: SSL
options.description: Negotiate SSL for incoming connections

options.name: SSLCert
options.description: Path to a custom SSL certificate (default is randomly generated)

options.name: SSLCompression
options.description: Enable SSL/TLS-level compression

options.name: SSLCipher
options.description: String for SSL cipher spec - "DHE-RSA-AES256-SHA" or "ADH"

options.name: TCP::max_send_size
options.description: Maximum tcp segment size.  (0 = disable)

options.name: TCP::send_delay
options.description: Delays inserted before every send.  (0 = disable)

options.name: URIPATH
options.description: The URI to use for this exploit (default is random)

options.name: HTTP::no_cache
options.description: Disallow the browser to cache HTTP content

options.name: HTTP::chunked
options.description: Enable chunking of HTTP responses via "Transfer-Encoding: chunked"

options.name: HTTP::header_folding
options.description: Enable folding of HTTP headers

options.name: HTTP::junk_headers
options.description: Enable insertion of random junk HTTP headers

options.name: HTTP::compression
options.description: Enable compression of HTTP responses via content encoding (Accepted: none, gzip, deflate)

options.name: HTTP::server_name
options.description: Configures the Server header of all outgoing replies

options.name: URIHOST
options.description: Host to use in URI (useful for tunnels)

options.name: URIPORT
options.description: Port to use in URI (useful for tunnels)

options.name: SendRobots
options.description: Return a robots.txt file if asked for one

options.name: HTML::unicode
options.description: Enable HTTP obfuscation via unicode (Accepted: none, utf-16le, utf-16be, utf-16be-marker, utf-32le, utf-32be)

options.name: HTML::base64
options.description: Enable HTML obfuscation via an embeded base64 html object (IE not supported) (Accepted: none, plain, single_pad, double_pad, random_space_injection)

options.name: HTML::javascript::escape
options.description: Enable HTML obfuscation via HTML escaping (number of iterations)

options.name: JsObfuscate
options.description: Number of times to obfuscate JavaScript

options.name: JsIdentifiers
options.description: Identifiers to preserve for JsObfu

options.name: Retries
options.description: Allow the browser to retry the module

options.name: CookieName
options.description: The name of the tracking cookie

options.name: CookieExpiration
options.description: Cookie expiration in years (blank=expire on exit)

options.name: Custom404
options.description: An external custom 404 URL (Example: http://example.com/404.html)

options.name: PAYLOAD_FIREFOX
options.description: Payload for firefox browser exploits

options.name: PAYLOAD_FIREFOX_LPORT
options.description: Payload LPORT for firefox browser exploits

options.name: LHOST
options.description: The local host for the exploits and handlers

options.name: PAYLOAD_ANDROID
options.description: Payload for android browser exploits

options.name: PAYLOAD_ANDROID_LPORT
options.description: Payload LPORT for android browser exploits

options.name: PAYLOAD_WIN
options.description: Payload for win browser exploits

options.name: PAYLOAD_WIN_LPORT
options.description: Payload LPORT for win browser exploits

options.name: PAYLOAD_LINUX
options.description: Payload for linux browser exploits

options.name: PAYLOAD_LINUX_LPORT
options.description: Payload LPORT for linux browser exploits

options.name: PAYLOAD_UNIX
options.description: Payload for unix browser exploits

options.name: PAYLOAD_UNIX_LPORT
options.description: Payload LPORT for unix browser exploits

options.name: PAYLOAD_OSX
options.description: Payload for osx browser exploits

options.name: PAYLOAD_OSX_LPORT
options.description: Payload LPORT for osx browser exploits

options.name: PAYLOAD_JAVA
options.description: Payload for java browser exploits

options.name: PAYLOAD_JAVA_LPORT
options.description: Payload LPORT for java browser exploits

options.name: PAYLOAD_GENERIC
options.description: Payload for generic browser exploits

options.name: PAYLOAD_GENERIC_LPORT
options.description: Payload LPORT for generic browser exploits

options.name: INCLUDE_PATTERN
options.description: Pattern search to include specific modules

options.name: EXCLUDE_PATTERN
options.description: Pattern search to exclude specific modules

options.name: ExploitReloadTimeout
options.description: Number of milliseconds before trying the next exploit

options.name: MaxExploitCount
options.description: Number of browser exploits to load

options.name: HTMLContent
options.description: HTML Content

options.name: AllowedAddresses
options.description: A range of IPs you're interested in attacking

options.name: MaxSessionCount
options.description: Number of sessions to get

options.name: ShowExploitList
options.description: Show which exploits will actually be served to each client
